item.title: Obstructed path following Environment Agency Flood Alleviation Scheme completed 2012, 30th August
item.description:
The planning scheme for the flood alleviation scheme submitted by the Environment Agency included proposals for the extinguishment of parts of two paths and the diversion of EHU5 and EHU3. This was granted consent by Tewkesbury Borough on 9 December 2010 under planning reference 10/00893/FUL. An application was also made by Tewkesbury Borough Council (10/00894/FTP) for the diversion of parts of EHU 3 and EHU5 footpaths along with the extinguishment of parts of EHU3 and EHU2A under Town and Country Planning Act 1990 powers as the changes were necessary to enable the development to take place. The proposed changes are shown in one of the photographs attached. This was supported at the time by Hucclecote Parish Council and consultation had taken place with the Gloucester Group of the Ramblers Association, details of this consultation are included in the design and access statement to the planning application. This application is now problematic as Town and Country Planning powers to divert/extinguish routes only exist before the development is “substantially complete” and in the normal course of events resolving this problem would require a new application under Highways Act powers. Four public authorities were involved in this project – Gloucestershire County Council, Gloucester City Council, the Environment Agency and Tewkesbury Borough Council. The evidence suggests that the Environment Agency made reasonable endeavours to resolve this matter. As Tewkesbury Borough Council did not progress the rights of way application it bears a high degree of responsibility for this. I have made a formal complaint on behalf of the Open Spaces Society, asking them to make the order under Highways Act powers at their own cost. I am in correspondence with a Senior Planning Compliance Officer at TBC who is currently taking legal advice from One Legal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gilpin Avenue, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
